item.title: New CrimeDoor app allows users to take a virtual look deeper at true crime case files
item.description: There's a new app that's giving users a closer look at crime scenes and gives access to case files with the hopes of providing answers.

item.title: San Benito County sees COVID-19 positivity rate above state average
item.description: As cases increase, so does the need for testing. In San Benito county, cases are up and resources are low.

item.title: Identity of woman in bizarre crash, ocean recovery in Santa Cruz County released
item.description: The crash happened north of Davenport on Monday shutting Highway 1 down in both directions.

item.title: Democrats boost slim majority in House with Florida special election win
item.description: Democrat Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick defeated Republican Jason Mariner in Florida's 20th Congressional District Tuesday, boosting the Democrats' slim majority in the House.

item.title: 'The Bob's Burgers Movie' trailer is here
item.description: Order up, "The Bob's Burgers Movie" trailer is here.

item.title: Oklahoma death row inmates argue firing squad as better alternative to lethal injection
item.description: On Monday, lawyers for two death row inmates argued to get the lethal injections of their clients delayed.

item.title: Musical stars Tool, J. Cole, Stevie Nicks to headline Bonnaroo music fest
item.description: Bonnaroo announces its star-studded 2022 musical lineup after last year's festival was canceled due to heavy rains and flooding from Hurricane Ida.

item.title: After cutting back early in the pandemic, Americans are getting themselves back into debt
item.description: The biggest driver of debt was not credit cards, but mortgage debt fueled by the housing boom.

item.title: Seeking a COVID-19 test in Monterey County? Expect long lines
item.description: COVID-19 testing in high demand in Monterey County

item.title: All 17 victims of Bronx apartment fire died of smoke inhalation, NYC medical examiner rules
item.description: The determination comes after an electric space heater sparked a fire in a duplex unit, flooding the 19-story apartment building with smoke.

item.title: Medicare limits coverage of $28,000-a-year Alzheimer's drug
item.description: Medicare says it will limit coverage of a $28,000-a-year Alzheimer's drug whose benefits have been widely questioned

item.title: If you use a space heater for warmth, these simple steps can help keep you safe
item.description: On average, fires caused by portable heaters cause 65 deaths and 150 injuries a year.

item.title: Jan. 6 committee subpoenas Trump aide, 2 GOP strategists
item.description: The Jan. 6 House panel subpoenaed a former White House aide they say helped draft former President Trump's Jan. 6 speech, along with two others it says were in communication with people close to Trump.

item.title: President Biden says he supports changing Senate rules to pass voting legislation
item.description: Biden is challenging senators to "stand against voter suppression," urging them to change Senate rules in order to pass voting rights legislation that Republicans are blocking from debate and votes.

item.title: Justice Department creating unit focused on domestic terrorism
item.description: The number of FBI investigations into suspected domestic violent extremists has more than doubled since the spring of 2020, according to Assistant Attorney General Matthew Olsen.

item.title: ‘We’re going to be inclusive’: Newsom speaks on plan for universal access to health care coverage
item.description: The proposed $2.2 billion program to aid undocumented immigrants in the country would not take effect until January 2024 to include “all low-income Californians, regardless of immigration status."

item.title: Dozens don blonde wigs for polar plunge honoring Massachusetts woman with ALS
item.description: The women's children have already raised over $150,000 to support her and help others who are battling the debilitating disease.

item.title: Four people, including infant, survive crash of medical transport helicopter
item.description: The helicopter was transporting an infant from Maryland to the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.

item.title: 83-year-old great-grandmother studying at Harvard 'needed to do something mentally to stay busy'
item.description: When she'd had her fill of puzzles during the pandemic, Barbara Ingram decided to take on a new challenge.

item.title: US, Russia stand their ground during initial talks on Ukraine
item.description: Moscow and Washington both took uncompromising stands Tuesday ahead of more talks amid a Russian troop buildup near Ukraine.
